<!-- 105 -->
<g id="node140" class="node">
<title>105</title>
<polygon fill="#00b2ee" stroke="transparent" points="26543,-1457.5 26543,-1499.5 26918,-1499.5 26918,-1457.5 26543,-1457.5"/>
<text text-anchor="start" x="26640.5" y="-1482.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00" fill="#000000">TURN 105 - STUDENT 9</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="26683" y="-1467.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00" fill="#000000">EXTENSION</text>
<polygon fill="#00b2ee" stroke="transparent" points="26543,-1310.5 26543,-1457.5 26918,-1457.5 26918,-1310.5 26543,-1310.5"/>
<text text-anchor="start" x="26572.5" y="-1440.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00" fill="#000000"> I think religion's only part of it. I feel like if</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="26549" y="-1425.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00" fill="#000000"> I was going to do something like that, you know, I</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="26573" y="-1410.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00" fill="#000000"> can't- I can put myself in other shoes, but I</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="26568" y="-1395.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00" fill="#000000"> can't actually put my life in there. I feel like,</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="26558" y="-1380.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00" fill="#000000"> you wouldn't want to feel, you wouldn't want to</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="26562" y="-1365.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00" fill="#000000"> experience these emotions, you wouldn't want</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="26560" y="-1350.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00" fill="#000000"> to think about it, I think you would just kind of</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="26561.5" y="-1335.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00" fill="#000000"> go numb after you go through a certain period</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="26572.5" y="-1320.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00" fill="#000000"> like that it's hard to come back afterwards.</text>
<polygon fill="#000000" stroke="#000000" points="26542,-1457.5 26542,-1457.5 26919,-1457.5 26919,-1457.5 26542,-1457.5"/>
<polygon fill="none" stroke="#000000" points="26541.5,-1310 26541.5,-1501 26918.5,-1501 26918.5,-1310 26541.5,-1310"/>
</g>

<!-- 106 -->
<g id="node141" class="node">
<title>106</title>
<polygon fill="#00b2ee" stroke="transparent" points="26621,-1222.5 26621,-1264.5 27003,-1264.5 27003,-1222.5 26621,-1222.5"/>
<text text-anchor="start" x="26722" y="-1247.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00" fill="#000000">TURN 106 - STUDENT 6</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="26764.5" y="-1232.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00" fill="#000000">EXTENSION</text>
<polygon fill="#00b2ee" stroke="transparent" points="26621,-1105.5 26621,-1222.5 27003,-1222.5 27003,-1105.5 26621,-1105.5"/>
<text text-anchor="start" x="26668.5" y="-1205.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00" fill="#000000"> After, to try to practice your religion, it</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="26632" y="-1190.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00" fill="#000000"> would be hard because it would put flashbacks in</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="26657" y="-1175.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00" fill="#000000"> your mind and maybe after awhile you can</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="26660.5" y="-1160.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00" fill="#000000"> actually continue practicing your religion</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="26645" y="-1145.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00" fill="#000000"> and then not have constant memories of what</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="26627" y="-1130.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00" fill="#000000"> happened when you were trying to survive and get</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="26799.5" y="-1115.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00" fill="#000000"> by.</text>
<polygon fill="#000000" stroke="#000000" points="26620,-1222.5 26620,-1222.5 27004,-1222.5 27004,-1222.5 26620,-1222.5"/>
<polygon fill="none" stroke="#000000" points="26620,-1105 26620,-1266 27004,-1266 27004,-1105 26620,-1105"/>
</g>

<!-- 107 -->
<g id="node142" class="node">
<title>107</title>
<polygon fill="#00b2ee" stroke="transparent" points="26787,-1003 26787,-1045 27157,-1045 27157,-1003 26787,-1003"/>
<text text-anchor="start" x="26877.5" y="-1027.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00" fill="#000000">TURN 107 - STUDENT 18</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="26924.5" y="-1012.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00" fill="#000000">EXTENSION</text>
<polygon fill="#00b2ee" stroke="transparent" points="26787,-871 26787,-1003 27157,-1003 27157,-871 26787,-871"/>
<text text-anchor="start" x="26811.5" y="-985.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00" fill="#000000"> I think one of the things a situation like this</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="26793" y="-970.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00" fill="#000000"> would change a person, but I don't think it would</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="26833.5" y="-955.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00" fill="#000000"> necessarily change their practicing of</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="26808.5" y="-940.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00" fill="#000000"> religion, because you can't blame everything</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="26808" y="-925.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00" fill="#000000"> on your God. This isn't their fault, bad things</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="26798" y="-910.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00" fill="#000000"> do happen in the world, obviously, but you can't</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="26808" y="-895.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00" fill="#000000"> just blame it all on your religion and just like</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="26922.5" y="-880.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00" fill="#000000"> give up on it.</text>
<polygon fill="#000000" stroke="#000000" points="26786,-1003 26786,-1003 27158,-1003 27158,-1003 26786,-1003"/>
<polygon fill="none" stroke="#000000" points="26786,-870 26786,-1046 27158,-1046 27158,-870 26786,-870"/>
</g>

<polygon fill="#ffff00" stroke="transparent" points="26461,-931 26461,-958 26752,-958 26752,-931 26461,-931"/>
<text text-anchor="start" x="26467" y="-940.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00" fill="#000000">Can we get a comment on Student 18?</text>
<polygon fill="#000000" stroke="#000000" points="26460,-958 26460,-958 26753,-958 26753,-958 26460,-958"/>

<!-- 108 -->
<g id="node144" class="node">
<title>108</title>
<polygon fill="#ff6347" stroke="transparent" points="27293,-2782.5 27293,-2824.5 27663,-2824.5 27663,-2782.5 27293,-2782.5"/>
<text text-anchor="start" x="27383.5" y="-2807.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00" fill="#000000">TURN 108 - STUDENT 27</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="27458.5" y="-2792.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00" fill="#000000">NEW</text>
<polygon fill="#ff6347" stroke="transparent" points="27293,-2695.5 27293,-2782.5 27663,-2782.5 27663,-2695.5 27293,-2695.5"/>
<text text-anchor="start" x="27304" y="-2765.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00" fill="#000000"> Going off what Student 18 said, religion is what</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="27308.5" y="-2750.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00" fill="#000000"> kept these people living, because they had the</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="27317.5" y="-2735.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00" fill="#000000"> right to pray even if- it wasn't allowed but it</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="27299" y="-2720.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00" fill="#000000"> was still keeping hope alive and hope that maybe</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="27362" y="-2705.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00" fill="#000000"> they would survive and get out.</text>
<polygon fill="#000000" stroke="#000000" points="27292,-2782.5 27292,-2782.5 27664,-2782.5 27664,-2782.5 27292,-2782.5"/>
<polygon fill="none" stroke="#000000" points="27292,-2695 27292,-2826 27664,-2826 27664,-2695 27292,-2695"/>
</g>

<!-- 109 -->
<g id="node145" class="node">
<title>109</title>
<polygon fill="#00b2ee" stroke="transparent" points="27295,-2360.5 27295,-2402.5 27655,-2402.5 27655,-2360.5 27295,-2360.5"/>
<text text-anchor="start" x="27380.5" y="-2385.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00" fill="#000000">TURN 109 - STUDENT 22</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="27427.5" y="-2370.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00" fill="#000000">EXTENSION</text>
<polygon fill="#00b2ee" stroke="transparent" points="27295,-2258.5 27295,-2360.5 27655,-2360.5 27655,-2258.5 27295,-2258.5"/>
<text text-anchor="start" x="27301" y="-2343.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00" fill="#000000"> Going off of what Student 27 said, when they're</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="27332" y="-2328.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00" fill="#000000"> taken away they're separate from their</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="27309" y="-2313.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00" fill="#000000"> families and everybody they know so the only</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="27310.5" y="-2298.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00" fill="#000000"> thing they have to rely on is their religion, so</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="27307.5" y="-2283.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00" fill="#000000"> that kind of helps them get through the tough</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="27450.5" y="-2268.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00" fill="#000000"> times.</text>
<polygon fill="#000000" stroke="#000000" points="27294,-2360.5 27294,-2360.5 27656,-2360.5 27656,-2360.5 27294,-2360.5"/>
<polygon fill="none" stroke="#000000" points="27294,-2257.5 27294,-2403.5 27656,-2403.5 27656,-2257.5 27294,-2257.5"/>
</g>

<!-- 110 -->
<g id="node146" class="node">
<title>110</title>
<polygon fill="#ffff00" stroke="transparent" points="27690,-2125 27690,-2152 28063,-2152 28063,-2125 27690,-2125"/>
<text text-anchor="start" x="27793.5" y="-2134.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00" fill="#000000">TURN 110 - TEACHER</text>
<polygon fill="#ffff00" stroke="transparent" points="27690,-2053 27690,-2125 28063,-2125 28063,-2053 27690,-2053"/>
<text text-anchor="start" x="27696" y="-2107.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00" fill="#000000"> Could a person recover when he lost his faith. We</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="27710.5" y="-2092.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00" fill="#000000"> know that one of the big themes of the text is</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="27708.5" y="-2077.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00" fill="#000000"> maintaining faith, so could a person recover if</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="27800" y="-2062.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00" fill="#000000"> he did lose his faith?</text>
<polygon fill="#000000" stroke="#000000" points="27689,-2125 27689,-2125 28064,-2125 28064,-2125 27689,-2125"/>
<polygon fill="none" stroke="#000000" points="27688.5,-2052.5 27688.5,-2153.5 28063.5,-2153.5 28063.5,-2052.5 27688.5,-2052.5"/>
</g>
<!-- 112 -->
<g id="node147" class="node">
<title>112</title>
<polygon fill="#00b2ee" stroke="transparent" points="27293,-2133 27293,-2175 27654,-2175 27654,-2133 27293,-2133"/>
<text text-anchor="start" x="27379" y="-2157.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00" fill="#000000">TURN 112 - STUDENT 12</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="27426" y="-2142.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00" fill="#000000">EXTENSION</text>
<polygon fill="#00b2ee" stroke="transparent" points="27293,-2031 27293,-2133 27654,-2133 27654,-2031 27293,-2031"/>
<text text-anchor="start" x="27307.5" y="-2115.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00" fill="#000000"> Going off of what Student 19 said, many Jews</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="27322.5" y="-2100.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00" fill="#000000"> probably steered away from being Jewish</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="27326.5" y="-2085.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00" fill="#000000"> because that's what got them into being</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="27299" y="-2070.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00" fill="#000000"> discriminated by Nazis. So, they could have run</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="27306" y="-2055.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00" fill="#000000"> away from it, but also come steered back to it</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="27441" y="-2040.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00" fill="#000000"> later on.</text>
<polygon fill="#000000" stroke="#000000" points="27292,-2133 27292,-2133 27655,-2133 27655,-2133 27292,-2133"/>
<polygon fill="none" stroke="#000000" points="27291.5,-2030 27291.5,-2176 27654.5,-2176 27654.5,-2030 27291.5,-2030"/>
</g>

<title>112--109</title>

</g>
<!-- 111 -->
<g id="node148" class="node">
<title>111</title>
<polygon fill="#ff6347" stroke="transparent" points="24812,-2790.5 24812,-2832.5 25172,-2832.5 25172,-2790.5 24812,-2790.5"/>
<text text-anchor="start" x="24897.5" y="-2815.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00" fill="#000000">TURN 111 - STUDENT 19</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="24972.5" y="-2800.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00" fill="#000000">NEW</text>
<polygon fill="#ff6347" stroke="transparent" points="24812,-2688.5 24812,-2790.5 25172,-2790.5 25172,-2688.5 24812,-2688.5"/>
<text text-anchor="start" x="24822" y="-2773.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00" fill="#000000"> I think that you can, because there's examples</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="24818" y="-2758.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00" fill="#000000"> where, say, a person loses a family member and</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="24829.5" y="-2743.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00" fill="#000000"> entirely loses their faith because they blame</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="24823" y="-2728.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00" fill="#000000"> it on their god. And ten years later they'll turn</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="24837.5" y="-2713.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00" fill="#000000"> back to it through some kind of event that</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="24957" y="-2698.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00" fill="#000000"> happens.</text>
<polygon fill="#000000" stroke="#000000" points="24811,-2790.5 24811,-2790.5 25173,-2790.5 25173,-2790.5 24811,-2790.5"/>
<polygon fill="none" stroke="#000000" points="24811,-2687.5 24811,-2833.5 25173,-2833.5 25173,-2687.5 24811,-2687.5"/>
</g>

</g>
<!-- 114 -->
<g id="node149" class="node">
<title>114</title>
<polygon fill="#00b2ee" stroke="transparent" points="24395,-3213 24395,-3255 24766,-3255 24766,-3213 24395,-3213"/>
<text text-anchor="start" x="24490.5" y="-3237.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00" fill="#000000">TURN 114 - STUDENT 5</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="24533" y="-3222.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00" fill="#000000">EXTENSION</text>
<polygon fill="#00b2ee" stroke="transparent" points="24395,-3111 24395,-3213 24766,-3213 24766,-3111 24395,-3111"/>
<text text-anchor="start" x="24406" y="-3195.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00" fill="#000000"> I think he's trying to show that, because he was</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="24412.5" y="-3180.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00" fill="#000000"> so religious and he lost his faith, it shows how</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="24401" y="-3165.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00" fill="#000000"> traumatic it was, because it was bad enough that</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="24416.5" y="-3150.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00" fill="#000000"> someone who's so deeply religious could lose</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="24408.5" y="-3135.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00" fill="#000000"> their faith. It would take a very bad experience</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="24511" y="-3120.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00" fill="#000000"> for that to happen.</text>
<polygon fill="#000000" stroke="#000000" points="24394,-3213 24394,-3213 24767,-3213 24767,-3213 24394,-3213"/>
<polygon fill="none" stroke="#000000" points="24393.5,-3110 24393.5,-3256 24766.5,-3256 24766.5,-3110 24393.5,-3110"/>
</g>

<title>114--114</title>

</g>
<!-- 115 -->
<g id="node150" class="node">
<title>115</title>
<polygon fill="#00b2ee" stroke="transparent" points="24385,-2820.5 24385,-2862.5 24776,-2862.5 24776,-2820.5 24385,-2820.5"/>
<text text-anchor="start" x="24486" y="-2845.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00" fill="#000000">TURN 115 - STUDENT 27</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="24533" y="-2830.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00" fill="#000000">EXTENSION</text>
<polygon fill="#00b2ee" stroke="transparent" points="24385,-2658.5 24385,-2820.5 24776,-2820.5 24776,-2658.5 24385,-2658.5"/>
<text text-anchor="start" x="24396.5" y="-2803.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00" fill="#000000"> Going off of what Student 5 said, for him to be one</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="24409.5" y="-2788.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00" fill="#000000"> of the most religious people and pray everyday</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="24391" y="-2773.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00" fill="#000000"> and go to the place where he did pray and go and- it</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="24400" y="-2758.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00" fill="#000000"> just shows you how traumatic and how hard of an</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="24410.5" y="-2743.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00" fill="#000000"> experience it was for all the Jewish people and</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="24427" y="-2728.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00" fill="#000000"> all the people that were religious that lost</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="24427" y="-2713.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00" fill="#000000"> their religion and lost their faith, that this</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="24422.5" y="-2698.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00" fill="#000000"> was probably the worst thing that had ever</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="24430" y="-2683.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00" fill="#000000"> happened and would ever happen, to him</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="24541" y="-2668.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00" fill="#000000"> especially.</text>
<polygon fill="#000000" stroke="#000000" points="24384,-2820.5 24384,-2820.5 24777,-2820.5 24777,-2820.5 24384,-2820.5"/>
<polygon fill="none" stroke="#000000" points="24383.5,-2657.5 24383.5,-2863.5 24776.5,-2863.5 24776.5,-2657.5 24383.5,-2657.5"/>
</g>

<!-- 113 -->
<g id="node151" class="node">
<title>113</title>
<polygon fill="#ffff00" stroke="transparent" points="23994,-2775.5 23994,-2802.5 24348,-2802.5 24348,-2775.5 23994,-2775.5"/>
<text text-anchor="start" x="24088" y="-2785.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00" fill="#000000">TURN 113 - TEACHER</text>
<polygon fill="#ffff00" stroke="transparent" points="23994,-2718.5 23994,-2775.5 24348,-2775.5 24348,-2718.5 23994,-2718.5"/>
<text text-anchor="start" x="24008.5" y="-2758.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00" fill="#000000"> Why does Elie show us that he, of all people,</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="24000" y="-2743.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00" fill="#000000"> struggles to maintain his faith? What's want to</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="24124.5" y="-2728.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00" fill="#000000"> prove to us?</text>
<polygon fill="#000000" stroke="#000000" points="23993,-2775.5 23993,-2775.5 24349,-2775.5 24349,-2775.5 23993,-2775.5"/>
<polygon fill="none" stroke="#000000" points="23993,-2717.5 23993,-2803.5 24349,-2803.5 24349,-2717.5 23993,-2717.5"/>
</g>
<!-- 116 -->
<g id="node152" class="node">
<title>116</title>
<polygon fill="#ff6347" stroke="transparent" points="28105,-2790.5 28105,-2832.5 28466,-2832.5 28466,-2790.5 28105,-2790.5"/>
<text text-anchor="start" x="28191" y="-2815.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00" fill="#000000">TURN 116 - STUDENT 24</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="28266" y="-2800.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00" fill="#000000">NEW</text>
<polygon fill="#ff6347" stroke="transparent" points="28105,-2688.5 28105,-2790.5 28466,-2790.5 28466,-2688.5 28105,-2688.5"/>
<text text-anchor="start" x="28116.5" y="-2773.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00" fill="#000000"> I think he had very high expectations for what</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="28111" y="-2758.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00" fill="#000000"> his God could provide for him, through how this</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="28120" y="-2743.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00" fill="#000000"> terrible thing could happen to him. He thinks</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="28116.5" y="-2728.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00" fill="#000000"> that his God will get him through this or make</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="28128.5" y="-2713.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00" fill="#000000"> sure this is over, that's what he thinks. But</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="28209.5" y="-2698.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00" fill="#000000"> that doesn't happen.</text>
<polygon fill="#000000" stroke="#000000" points="28104,-2790.5 28104,-2790.5 28467,-2790.5 28467,-2790.5 28104,-2790.5"/>
<polygon fill="none" stroke="#000000" points="28103.5,-2687.5 28103.5,-2833.5 28466.5,-2833.5 28466.5,-2687.5 28103.5,-2687.5"/>
</g>
<!-- 116--init9 -->
<!-- 116--116 -->
<g id="edge131" class="edge">
<title>116--116</title>
<path fill="none" stroke="#000000" d="M28393.0928,-2683.4544C28445.7953,-2673.5169 28492.5,-2699.1987 28492.5,-2760.5 28492.5,-2821.8013 28445.7953,-2847.4831 28393.0928,-2837.5456"/>

<!-- 117 -->
<g id="node153" class="node">
<title>117</title>
<polygon fill="#ff6347" stroke="transparent" points="28526,-2797.5 28526,-2839.5 28883,-2839.5 28883,-2797.5 28526,-2797.5"/>
<text text-anchor="start" x="28614.5" y="-2822.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00" fill="#000000">TURN 117 - STUDENT 9</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="28685" y="-2807.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00" fill="#000000">NEW</text>
<polygon fill="#ff6347" stroke="transparent" points="28526,-2680.5 28526,-2797.5 28883,-2797.5 28883,-2680.5 28526,-2680.5"/>
<text text-anchor="start" x="28537.5" y="-2780.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00" fill="#000000"> I think it really shows that even the strongest</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="28563" y="-2765.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00" fill="#000000"> and most faithful still stumble and still</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="28563" y="-2750.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00" fill="#000000"> question and I think it's just natural to</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="28532" y="-2735.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00" fill="#000000"> question when something so traumatic is going</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="28540.5" y="-2720.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00" fill="#000000"> on, but I think it also shows that you recover</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="28561.5" y="-2705.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00" fill="#000000"> from it, you can pull back, because you</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="28632" y="-2690.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00" fill="#000000"> survived, you lived.</text>
<polygon fill="#000000" stroke="#000000" points="28525,-2797.5 28525,-2797.5 28884,-2797.5 28884,-2797.5 28525,-2797.5"/>
<polygon fill="none" stroke="#000000" points="28524.5,-2680 28524.5,-2841 28883.5,-2841 28883.5,-2680 28524.5,-2680"/>
</g>
<!-- 117--init8 -->
<!-- 117--117 -->

<title>117--117</title>

<!-- 118 -->
<g id="node154" class="node">
<title>118</title>
<polygon fill="#ff6347" stroke="transparent" points="29767,-2790.5 29767,-2832.5 30131,-2832.5 30131,-2790.5 29767,-2790.5"/>
<text text-anchor="start" x="29854.5" y="-2815.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00" fill="#000000">TURN 118 - STUDENT 16</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="29929.5" y="-2800.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00" fill="#000000">NEW</text>
<polygon fill="#ff6347" stroke="transparent" points="29767,-2688.5 29767,-2790.5 30131,-2790.5 30131,-2688.5 29767,-2688.5"/>
<text text-anchor="start" x="29779.5" y="-2773.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00" fill="#000000"> Going back to what Student 27 said, I feel like</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="29773" y="-2758.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00" fill="#000000"> you'd be able to recover but you wouldn't be the</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="29773.5" y="-2743.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00" fill="#000000"> same, this was always going to be a part of your</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="29782" y="-2728.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00" fill="#000000"> life, it's always going to be on your mind after</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="29789.5" y="-2713.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00" fill="#000000"> life. And it's always going to be part of your</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="29920" y="-2698.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00" fill="#000000"> history.</text>
<polygon fill="#000000" stroke="#000000" points="29766,-2790.5 29766,-2790.5 30132,-2790.5 30132,-2790.5 29766,-2790.5"/>
<polygon fill="none" stroke="#000000" points="29766,-2687.5 29766,-2833.5 30132,-2833.5 30132,-2687.5 29766,-2687.5"/>
</g>
<!-- 118--init7 -->
<!-- 118--118 -->

<title>118--118</title>

<!-- 120 -->
<g id="node155" class="node">
<title>120</title>
<polygon fill="#ffffff" stroke="transparent" points="29365,-2797.5 29365,-2839.5 29731,-2839.5 29731,-2797.5 29365,-2797.5"/>
<text text-anchor="start" x="29458" y="-2822.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00" fill="#000000">TURN 120 - STUDENT 5</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="29529" y="-2807.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00" fill="#000000">NON</text>
<polygon fill="#ffffff" stroke="transparent" points="29365,-2680.5 29365,-2797.5 29731,-2797.5 29731,-2680.5 29365,-2680.5"/>
<text text-anchor="start" x="29381" y="-2780.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00" fill="#000000"> I have a question for chapter 2 for page 24. It</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="29371" y="-2765.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00" fill="#000000"> says that in exchange for a gold watch they they</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="29389.5" y="-2750.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00" fill="#000000"> discovered that they'd be getting out of the</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="29380" y="-2735.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00" fill="#000000"> labor camp, but then just a couple lines below</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="29382.5" y="-2720.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00" fill="#000000"> that it says that their confidence soared, why</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="29374.5" y="-2705.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00" fill="#000000"> do you think their confidence soared when they</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="29374.5" y="-2690.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00" fill="#000000"> really knew they were going to the labor camp?</text>
<polygon fill="#000000" stroke="#000000" points="29364,-2797.5 29364,-2797.5 29732,-2797.5 29732,-2797.5 29364,-2797.5"/>
<polygon fill="none" stroke="#000000" points="29364,-2680 29364,-2841 29732,-2841 29732,-2680 29364,-2680"/>
</g>
<!-- 119 -->
<g id="node156" class="node">
<title>119</title>
<polygon fill="#ffff00" stroke="transparent" points="28944,-2857.5 28944,-2884.5 29329,-2884.5 29329,-2857.5 28944,-2857.5"/>
<text text-anchor="start" x="29053.5" y="-2867.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00" fill="#000000">TURN 119 - TEACHER</text>
<polygon fill="#ffff00" stroke="transparent" points="28944,-2635.5 28944,-2857.5 29329,-2857.5 29329,-2635.5 28944,-2635.5"/>
<text text-anchor="start" x="28955.5" y="-2840.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00" fill="#000000"> And remember why he includes this. He wants us</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="28973" y="-2825.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00" fill="#000000"> to- he has a choice of what's in this book, it's</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="28956" y="-2810.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00" fill="#000000"> his experience, he can say whatever he wants, he</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="28950" y="-2795.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00" fill="#000000"> includes this, so we know how bad it was. Even the</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="28981.5" y="-2780.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00" fill="#000000"> most faithful of the faithful lost their faith,</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="28953" y="-2765.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00" fill="#000000"> and therefore if we know that it was that bad then</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="28966.5" y="-2750.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00" fill="#000000"> we'll make sure nothing like this ever happens</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="28962" y="-2735.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00" fill="#000000"> again. It's all part of his goal. We know how bad</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="28975" y="-2720.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00" fill="#000000"> it was, even the faithful lost their faith, then</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="28989.5" y="-2705.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00" fill="#000000"> hopefully we'll learn from that. We'll see</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="28957" y="-2690.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00" fill="#000000"> "Wow! It must have been pretty bad", and not let</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="28962" y="-2675.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00" fill="#000000"> anything like this happen again. So I do want to</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="28968" y="-2660.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00" fill="#000000"> talk about chapter 2. Chapter 2 is interesting.</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="28960" y="-2645.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00" fill="#000000"> What are your thoughts on chapter 2? Anything.</text>
<polygon fill="#000000" stroke="#000000" points="28943,-2857.5 28943,-2857.5 29330,-2857.5 29330,-2857.5 28943,-2857.5"/>
<polygon fill="none" stroke="#000000" points="28942.5,-2635 28942.5,-2886 29329.5,-2886 29329.5,-2635 28942.5,-2635"/>
</g>
<!-- 121 -->
<g id="node157" class="node">
<title>121</title>
<polygon fill="#ff6347" stroke="transparent" points="30610,-2775.5 30610,-2817.5 30965,-2817.5 30965,-2775.5 30610,-2775.5"/>
<text text-anchor="start" x="30697.5" y="-2800.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00" fill="#000000">TURN 121 - STUDENT 6</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="30768" y="-2785.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00" fill="#000000">NEW</text>
<polygon fill="#ff6347" stroke="transparent" points="30610,-2703.5 30610,-2775.5 30965,-2775.5 30965,-2703.5 30610,-2703.5"/>
<text text-anchor="start" x="30616" y="-2758.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00" fill="#000000"> I think because it's better than going right to a</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="30637.5" y="-2743.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00" fill="#000000"> place where you're killed immediately, at</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="30619" y="-2728.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00" fill="#000000"> least you get to live a little bit longer or might</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="30756.5" y="-2713.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00" fill="#000000"> survive.</text>
<polygon fill="#000000" stroke="#000000" points="30609,-2775.5 30609,-2775.5 30966,-2775.5 30966,-2775.5 30609,-2775.5"/>
<polygon fill="none" stroke="#000000" points="30608.5,-2702.5 30608.5,-2818.5 30965.5,-2818.5 30965.5,-2702.5 30608.5,-2702.5"/>
</g>
<!-- 121--init6 -->
<!-- 121--121 -->
<g id="edge137" class="edge">
<title>121--121</title>
<path fill="none" stroke="#000000" d="M30852.4437,-2698.4723C30918.3651,-2662.5536 30991.5,-2683.2295 30991.5,-2760.5 30991.5,-2837.7705 30918.3651,-2858.4464 30852.4437,-2822.5277"/>
</g>
<!-- 122 -->
<g id="node158" class="node">
<title>122</title>
<polygon fill="#ffff00" stroke="transparent" points="30191,-2850.5 30191,-2877.5 30573,-2877.5 30573,-2850.5 30191,-2850.5"/>
<text text-anchor="start" x="30299" y="-2860.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00" fill="#000000">TURN 122 - TEACHER</text>
<polygon fill="#ffff00" stroke="transparent" points="30191,-2643.5 30191,-2850.5 30573,-2850.5 30573,-2643.5 30191,-2643.5"/>
<text text-anchor="start" x="30207.5" y="-2833.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00" fill="#000000"> I don't think they knew. They didn't know. What</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="30212.5" y="-2818.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00" fill="#000000"> was happening at this time was unfathomable,</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="30213" y="-2803.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00" fill="#000000"> nothing like this had ever happened before, so</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="30219.5" y="-2788.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00" fill="#000000"> they didn't know what being in a labor camp</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="30206.5" y="-2773.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00" fill="#000000"> meant. They just thought it meant "you're going</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="30209.5" y="-2758.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00" fill="#000000"> to do work for the war effort" and I think that's</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="30220.5" y="-2743.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00" fill="#000000"> it and the other things they were thinking is</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="30197" y="-2728.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00" fill="#000000"> "The Germans are trying to keep us away from the</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="30213.5" y="-2713.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00" fill="#000000"> war", but what is happening is unfathomable I</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="30209.5" y="-2698.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00" fill="#000000"> don't think they ever would have imagined that</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="30202.5" y="-2683.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00" fill="#000000"> that's what they were going to do. So I think that</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="30212" y="-2668.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00" fill="#000000"> answers your question. But it does seem- what</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="30323.5" y="-2653.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00" fill="#000000"> literary device?</text>
<polygon fill="#000000" stroke="#000000" points="30190,-2850.5 30190,-2850.5 30574,-2850.5 30574,-2850.5 30190,-2850.5"/>
<polygon fill="none" stroke="#000000" points="30190,-2642.5 30190,-2878.5 30574,-2878.5 30574,-2642.5 30190,-2642.5"/>
</g>
<!-- 123 -->
<g id="node159" class="node">
<title>123</title>
<polygon fill="#ff6347" stroke="transparent" points="31851,-2752.5 31851,-2794.5 32043,-2794.5 32043,-2752.5 31851,-2752.5"/>
<text text-anchor="start" x="31857" y="-2777.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00" fill="#000000">TURN 123 - STUDENT 9</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="31927.5" y="-2762.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00" fill="#000000">NEW</text>

That is why I am teaching you this book. So try not to just read it on the surface, put yourself in it, put yourself in the role of Elie. That's what he wants you to do, that's why it's first person! That's why he is the protagonist and the survivor and the author- it's all intentional. He wants you to experience it as awful as you possibly can, so that you know how bad it is. So we made a comment yesterday, "no survivor could begin to tell a spark of the flame of the story", right? So even though we're never gonna understand it completely or be able to put ourselves in the shoes completely, put yourselves in his shoes as much as you possibly can, because if you know how bad it was and you're feeling these emotions that Elie makes you feel, then you're not gonna let something like this happen. Like I told you, you guys are the future, you guys are gonna grow up and you have to be the ones who don't hate, who don't discriminate, those of you- you guys all have to be the ones who are accepting of tolerant and teach your friends and your children those things so that nothing like this ever happens again. So I caution you from just reading this on the surface. Read this deeper than any book you've read and will read this year and put yourself in his shoes, relate as much as you possibly can. Any comments, there? Any questions, there? Do you think it's gonna be hard to do?
